tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Achromatic
tags.description: Contains animation that is primarily done in black and white.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/124182562)

An extremely prolific animator often appearing in dozens of shows yearly.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kudo_M_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kudo_m_/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVcxdd04vCuhr-1t7mDh3gg)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Most known for his work on the [Bleach](https://anilist.co/anime/269/) franchise.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/若林厚史)

Veteran Japanese animator, storyboard artist, and director. After joining [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) and then [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/), Wakabayashi finally landed at [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/), where he was considered the backbone of the studio's animation in the 90s. 

He is known for his bombastic animation style, which makes the designs he draws look malleable and often exaggerated. He was influenced by animators such as [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/) and [Kouji Morimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100066/), and he is also a friend of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/). His direction is inspired by Japanese live-action cinema as well as French directors such as Luc Besson.

Wakabayashi gained considerable notoriety on the NARUTO series, which he was invited to work on by [Hayato Date](https://anilist.co/staff/100843/) after a chance meeting at Pierrot. He is best known for storyboarding and directing episode 167 of [NARUTO: Shippuuden](https://anilist.co/anime/1735/): Naruto vs. Pain.

His main focus in anime these days is more on storyboarding, as he feels that the changes in the anime industry do not allow him to animate as freely as he used to.
Veteran animator specialized in effects animation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/124182562)

An extremely prolific animator often appearing in dozens of shows yearly.
Veteran animator specialized in effects animation.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/若林厚史)

Veteran Japanese animator, storyboard artist, and director. After joining [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) and then [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/), Wakabayashi finally landed at [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/), where he was considered the backbone of the studio's animation in the 90s. 

He is known for his bombastic animation style, which makes the designs he draws look malleable and often exaggerated. He was influenced by animators such as [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/) and [Kouji Morimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100066/), and he is also a friend of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/). His direction is inspired by Japanese live-action cinema as well as French directors such as Luc Besson.

Wakabayashi gained considerable notoriety on the NARUTO series, which he was invited to work on by [Hayato Date](https://anilist.co/staff/100843/) after a chance meeting at Pierrot. He is best known for storyboarding and directing episode 167 of [NARUTO: Shippuuden](https://anilist.co/anime/1735/): Naruto vs. Pain.

His main focus in anime these days is more on storyboarding, as he feels that the changes in the anime industry do not allow him to animate as freely as he used to.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ShiroSAGISU_twi)

__Non-Anime Credits:__ 
- Music composer for ''Neon Genesis Evangelion'' (N64, VG) (Japanese) 
- Music composer for ''Shining Force Neo'' (VG)
- Music composer for ''Attack on Titan (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for'' Attack on Titan II: End of the World (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for ''Shin Godzilla''
- Music composer for ''Shin Ultraman''

[Profile](https://asahi-pro.co.jp/creator/yamada-kazuhiro)

Affiliated with Asahi Production.

_Note: Not to be confused with the other [composite artist](https://anilist.co/staff/252146/) by the same name._

[Website](https://six-lounge.com/) | [Profile (Universal Music)](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/six-lounge/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/lounge666) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLJPXgBfO2aoX8p69w4Dipw)

Rock and roll band from Oita, Japan. Current members:
- Yamaguchi Koumori (ヤマグチユウモリ) - Vocals/Guitar
- Iwao Riku (イワオリク) - Bass/Chorus (Joined 2015)
- Nagamatsu Shintarou (ナガマツシンタロウ) - Drums/Chorus
